intro: Limnia saxosa, commonly known as the saxicolous limnia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows on rocky or limestone substrates, showcasing its saxicolous habit. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers with five petals, often in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. Limnia saxosa is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in rocky crevices.
